author: La Nación
title: La Nación / Crazy Week de CDE tuvo buen flujo turístico, pero lluvia conspiró para que el éxito sea completo
text: Hoy comenzó el primer día de la feria de descuentos en el comercio de Ciudad del Este, denominado “Crazy Week”, con una gran afluencia de compradores brasileños y argentinos, a pesar de la intensa lluvia de toda la jornada que disminuyó el movimiento con relación a la expectativa previa sobre el primer día del evento, que se extenderá hasta el domingo 12 de mayo. La circulación por el Puente de la Amistad y el flujo de vehículos a partir de la tarde mostró que, si bien mermó la cantidad esperada, muchos compradores vinieron a Ciudad del Este. Con el slogan “descuentos sin límites”, la Cámara de Comercio y Servicios organiza esta feria para instalar el evento dentro de la agenda de compras de la región, aprovechando el Día de las Madres que, en Brasil se celebra el domingo 12 de mayo y en Paraguay el 15 de mayo. Con pilotines para lluvia, los visitantes esperaron frente a los negocios la apertura de puertas a primera hora de la mañana y luego irrumpieron en masa en los locales para aprovechar los descuentos. El acto de apertura se realizó en la zona primaria, donde estuvieron los directivos del gremio organizador y las instituciones estatales que ayudan al emprendimiento; Secretaría Nacional de Turismo, Gobernación, Municipalidad de Ciudad del Este, Policía Nacional y Policía Turística, La Senatur declaró de interés turístico nacional el evento y la comuna de interés distrital. Son 60 locales adheridos al Crazy Week y más de 20 patrocinadores, según la Cámara de Comercio de Ciudad del Este. Puede interesarle: Tarifa de Itaipú: acuerdo será fundamental para el desarrollo económico, sostiene ministro “Estamos contentos porque la gente vino a comprar, las tiendas estaban con turistas, la apertura de puertas de las tiendas fue con muchos compradores y eso es lo que importa”, dijo Armando Ghazawi, coordinador del evento de descuentos en el comercio de Ciudad del Este. Mencionó que la lluvia afectó en cuanto a expectativas, pero el movimiento fue grande y esperan mayor afluencia mañana y el mayor pico esperado es para el sábado. Destacó que todas las instituciones hicieron su parte en cuanto a seguridad y circulación en el tránsito y, si bien hubo filas al final de la tarde para pasar por el Puente de la Amistad, ya es parte de lo esperado y la imagen sobre el paso internacional mostró que el comercio de Ciudad del Este estuvo más movimiento hoy que días anteriores. Puede interesarle: CAP: expresan preocupación ante el ingreso de productos ilegales desde Brasil [#Crazy Week en CDE](/tag/crazy-week-en-cde/) [#Mucho movimiento](/tag/mucho-movimiento/) [#Menos que lo esperado](/tag/menos-que-lo-esperado/) [#Descuentos hasta el 12 de mayo](/tag/descuentos-hasta-el-12-de-mayo/) [#Compradores brasileños](/tag/compradores-brasilenos/) [#Lluvia hizo lo suyo](/tag/lluvia-hizo-lo-suyo/)

author: Oraily Madruga Rios
title: Allende’s grandson calls for enhancing solidarity with Gazans
text: People have been rioting all over the world. Likewise, at the UN, the vast majority of countries asked for a ceasefire; that is very significant, but unfortunately, the United States imposed its veto on the Security Council, Sepulveda Allende told Prensa Latina. The internationalist doctor described as a milestone South Africa’s decision to file a lawsuit in the International Court of Justice in The Hague, against Israel, who is being accused of the massacre against Palestinians. According to the latest count of the Ministry of Health in Gaza, the death toll since the onset of Tel Aviv’s military offensive amounts to over 30,900, and the injured exceeds 72,000 persons, in addition to the fact that almost 8,000 bodies are missing under the rubble. Sepulveda Allende welcomed the Chilean Government’s decision to cut off Israeli military companies’ participation in the International Air and Space Fair (FIDAE), scheduled to take place here next April. Allende’s grandson further praised the visit paid to that nation by Aleida Guevara, Commander Che’s daughter, and Nkosi Zwelivelile Mandela, grandson of former South African President Nelson Mandela, as ambassadors of the Global Campaign for the Right to Return to Palestine. Chile shelters the largest Palestinian community outside the Middle East; therefore, it is paramount to be here to make visible both Gazans’ cause and the ongoing genocide that is being committed, Allende’s grandson said. jrr/omr/mem/car

title: Family Private Care Affirms Its Commitment to Quality Home Care in Lawrenceville, GA | observernewsonline.com
text:
Family Private Care Services in Lawrenceville, GA, reaffirms its commitment to providing top-tier home care, ensuring comfort and dignity for seniors in their own homes. With a focus on personalized care plans and holistic well-being, they continue to meet the community's needs for reliable, compassionate service. For more details, Google it at https://familyprivatecarellc.com Lawrenceville, GA - Family Private Care Services, a foremost provider in the realm of home care services, today reasserts its pledge to maintain the highest standards of home care for residents of Lawrenceville, GA. This announcement underscores the organization's enduring commitment to the community, ensuring that local families seeking senior care in Lawrenceville, GA, for their loved ones, will continue to have access to unparalleled support, fostering both comfort and dignity in their own homes. This ongoing commitment is a response to the consistent demand from the community for reliable and superior home care solutions, spotlighting the significance of tailored care plans and the holistic well-being of every individual served.
"Family Private Care stands as a beacon of excellence in Lawrenceville, continually striving to elevate the standard of home care provided to our community," stated Tony Plummer, owner of Family Private Care Services. "Our dedication goes beyond providing services; it's about nurturing a network of support for our families, ensuring every individual in our care lives a fulfilling life. As we move forward, our commitment to this mission is unwavering, driven by a desire to meet and exceed the evolving needs of our community, thereby affirming that our clients and their families receive the compassionate, personalized care they truly deserve."
At the heart of Family Private Care's philosophy is a personalized approach to home care designed to meet each client's needs. From daily living support to comprehensive health care needs, this bespoke approach guarantees clients an enhanced quality of life, promoting independence, comfort, and overall well-being.
Families in Lawrenceville, GA, searching for premier home care services can turn to Family Private Care for their loved ones' needs.
For more information about Family Private Care Services and their home care in Lawrenceville, GA , please visit their website at https://familyprivatecarellc.com
About Family Private Care Services:
Family Private Care is a leading provider of home care services in Lawrenceville, GA. Renowned for its commitment to excellence and a team of devoted care professionals, Family Private Care offers an extensive range of services tailored to meet the varied needs of the elderly community. Dedicated to improving the lives of seniors and their families, Family Private Care remains the preferred choice for those searching for compassionate, high-quality care in the comfort of their homes.

author: Canadian Press
title: Union representing 40 per cent of Quebec teachers reaches deal, ends unlimited strike
text:
MONTREAL — A union representing 40 per cent of Quebec teachers has reached a deal in principle with the government and is ending a strike that has shut around 800 schools since Nov. 23.
Fédération autonome de l’enseignement — or FAE — said Thursday night on social media that it spent the day analyzing a tentative deal with the province and will recommend it to its members for approval during general assemblies after the holidays. Details of the agreement have not been released.
Even though the FAE called the deal "a new step," it emphasized "it is up to the teachers to respond to (Premier) François Legault's government and to say whether they feel they have been heard."
The union said it has ended all of its pressure tactics, such as the general strike that has shut 800 schools, including in Montreal, since the end of November. If students affected by the FAE strike return to school as scheduled in January, they will have been away from classes for almost seven consecutive weeks.
The FAE, which represents more than 66,000 teachers, took the most hard line out of all the public sector unions negotiating new contracts with the government when it launched an unlimited general strike.
Earlier today, the government announced it had reached tentative deals on salaries with an alliance of unions, excluding the FAE, representing 420,000 public sector employees, including teachers and health-care workers. They had walked out sporadically since November, for a total of 11 days.
The only major labour group without any sort of agreement is a nurses union with about 80,000 members — Fédération interprofessionnelle de la santé du Québec — which said today that negotiations are ongoing.
Earlier Thursday, before the FAE announced the end to its strike, Sylvain Martel, spokesman for parents group Regroupement des comités de parents autonomes du Québec, said he was feeling optimistic but remaining cautious that 800 schools would reopen after the holiday break.
"We're glad that we're able to hope for going back to school on Jan. 9, but everything is tentative, lots of people have to agree to what's on the table, so let's hope that it's a real deal and (union) members will get what they want," he said in an interview.
Martel said discussions have been taking place between teachers, parents and administrators about how children will catch up after missing so much school. How that happens will vary, he said, because the effects of the strikes were unequal — some parents taught their children at home, others hired tutors, but many less-fortunate students spent weeks with little to no learning at all.
"It's very difficult for students to go back to the same rhythm they were in November, so it's going to take a little while, but we'll get there," he said.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023.
The Canadian Press

author: WQAD
title: Volunteer ambulance service for rural Illinois community facing critical staffing shortage - NewsBreak
text:

Volunteer ambulance service for rural Illinois community facing critical staffing shortage

author: sina.com.cn
title: 南京发力打造"机器人之城"：用3年时间"强攻"具身机器人|机器人_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
当AI赋予 机器人 以“具身”，一个崭新的世界缓缓打开。面对具身机器人产业的“风口”，不少城市正跃跃欲试。
6月11日，江苏南京举行2025智能机器人发展大会。本次大会旨在准确把握机器人产业发展新趋势与新机遇，深入交流对接，深化产学研合作，加快推动机器人产业高质量发展。
会上，志在打造“机器人之城”的南京亮出竞逐具身智能机器人产业的雄心：到2027年，核心产业规模力争超过100亿元，培育5家以上整机量产企业，产业综合实力跻身全国前列。
本文图片由主办方提供 各路专家为南京“支招”
此次大会上，多位专家为南京发展机器人产业“支招”。
“人工智能、大数据、先进传感等技术快速演进，并与机器人技术深度融合，正在加速重塑机器人的能力边界与应用场景，其发展趋势呈现出鲜明的智能化、协同化、泛在化特征。”中国机械工业联合会机器人分会副秘书长陈丹在作智能机器人发展趋势报告时说。
陈丹表示，传统机器人本体设计聚焦于刚性执行机构的运动性能，结构本身缺乏深度集成的传感器与嵌入式算力单元，使其无法成为具身智能技术的有效物体载体。因此，未来需要突破传统硬件范式，软件与硬件协同设计，对本体进行深层次智能重构，使机器人更好地融入AI生态、适应复杂非结构环境。
具身机器人被称为“有身体的AI”，不仅拥有“聪明大脑”，更配上了能动的“身体”，能像人类一样感知环境、自主决策、动手干活。陈丹说，未来机器人将实现从孤立传感器到融合认知的进化，形成机器人“身体—环境”的具身统一认知，从而与决策控制有机协同，并通过构建对物理和社会环境因果变化规律准确理解的模型，支持机器人“感知—想象—推演—决策”的作业闭环。
“机器人性能已步入‘软件决定’时代，当前国产硬件技术逐步取得突破。同等硬件条件下，国产机器人稳定性、精确性与同系列国外机器人相比还有待提升。”哈尔滨工业大学机器人研究所所长赵杰教授在主旨报告中表示，国产工业机器人突破核心技术提升整机性能迫在眉睫，亟需突破软件共性关键技术及核心算法。
南京将出台行动计划攻坚具身机器人
近年来，南京机器人产业发展迅猛，已形成整机、关键零部件以及系统集成应用的全链条机器人产业体系，集聚产业链上下游重点企业近200家，总体发展水平居全国前列。其中，南京 埃斯顿 自动化公司作为该市机器人产业“链主”企业，今年一季度市场份额占全国的比重达10.3%，成为国内市占率最高的国产机器人品牌。
去年，南京提出打造具有影响力的“机器人之城”。今年3月，该市成立4个产业攻坚推进办公室，其中之一就是机器人产业。
面对具身智能机器人的产业“风口”，南京自然不会错过。在本次大会上，南京揭牌了具身智能机器人产业园，并成立具身智能机器人产业生态联盟。
澎湃新闻从会上获悉，南京还将出台《南京市具身智能机器人产业发展行动计划（2025—2027年）》，目标是到2027年，全市具身智能机器人核心产业规模力争超过100亿元，培育5家以上拥有整机量产能力的具身智能机器人企业，引育150家以上整机、关键零部件及具身智能大模型企业。
《行动计划》从打造软硬件产品、构建产业创新体系、推动场景示范应用、提升产业集群化水平等方面明确了具体推进措施，包括联合软件龙头企业建设具身智能创新中心，建设具身智能数据采集和训练中心、概念验证中心等公共服务平台，鼓励机关事业单位、国有企业、板块园区带头打造具身智能机器人应用场景等。
澎湃新闻记者 邱海鸿
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing
Economy, Business and Finance->manufacturing and engineering
Economy, Business and Finance->computing and information technology

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for. During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Hosek standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Hosek would soon have no time to stand around as " Spirals: Hot Dogs & More ," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral. "We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Hosek told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me." The day the photo was taken, Hosek found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Hosek said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down. Hosek wouldn't hear of it. "You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance. Noticing Hosek gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in." "A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said. In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Hosek waiting for diners. Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit. "I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post." Hosek is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so. The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalapeños, Hosek said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of. The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact. Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family. "To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesn’t have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Hosek added.
